comment.author: 45586426@N06
comment._content:
Four A3D-2 Skywarrior lined up on starboard side.
Modex side codes; 9,4,1 & 10?
Early style canopy and nosecone. Wings without cambered leading edge. 
An A4D Skyhawk on final approach to land.
On board CVA-59 USS Forrestal.
Date, location, occasion or squadrons; unknown.

comment.author: 25623069@N08
comment._content: Looks like an FJ Fury landing...

comment.author: 45586426@N06
comment._content: Well spotted big red! got my cross eye sorted and took a real close look see.... perhaps this is 1957..... the 'All Three Dead' [A3D] may be from VAH-1 'Smokin Tigers' and the Fury might be an FJ-3M of VF-84 'Vagabonds' A CVA-59 USS Forrestal deployment record: www.gonavy.jp/CV-CV59f.html navysite.de/cvn/cv59deploy.htm Period VAH-1 A3D pics and info: www.boeing.com/companyoffices/gallery/a3d.htm en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:A3D_crash_on_USS_Forrestal_(CVA-59)_1957.jpg www.flickr.com/photos/my_public_domain_photos/4494894611/ www.joebaugher.com/usattack/newa3_7.html here's a pic of a VF-84 FJ-3M aboard CVA-59 USS Forrestal in 1957: en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:FJ-3M_CVA-59_NAN9-57.jpg also the Lockheed CL-1200/1600 Lancer project may have been a far far better plane than the F-104 ..... if it had been allowed to be built and tested en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lockheed_CL-1200
